intro: Clermontia forbesii, commonly known as the Kauai clermontia, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and streamside areas. It is known for its ornate, lance-shaped leaves and is considered an endemic species, found only in specific locations on the island. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is listed as endangered, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
